description: The image is a line graph titled "Tether's USDT Dominates Stablecoin Market." It illustrates the market share of Tether (USDT) in the stablecoin market over a period from March 2021 to January 2024. The graph is set against a black background with white text and lines.  There are three lines on the graph, each representing a different category of stablecoins:  1. USDT (blue line) 2. USDC (yellow line) 3. Others (green line)  The x-axis of the graph represents time, with months from March 2021 to January 2024 marked along the bottom. The y-axis represents the market share in billions of dollars, with increments of $50 billion.  The blue line, representing USDT, shows a significant increase in market share over the period, starting at around $50 billion in March 2021 and reaching over $150 billion by January 2024. The yellow line, representing USDC, shows a smaller increase, starting at around $20 billion in March 2021 and reaching just over $50 billion by January 2024. The green line, representing others, shows a slight decrease in market share, starting at around $30 billion in March 2021 and ending just under $50 billion by January 2024.  The graph is sourced from DeFilama, as indicated at the bottom. The overall trend suggests that USDT has been the dominant stablecoin in the market,
